translated: The Numerical Discourses
The Analyses
The Chapter on the Arising of Thoughts🔽Skillful Thoughts Associated with the Formless Absorptions
The four formless absorptions, sixteen in all

original: Katame dhammā kusalā?🔽Yasmiṁ samaye arūpūpapattiyā maggaṁ bhāveti sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ🔽atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ākāsānañcāyatanasaññāsahagataṁ sukhassa ca
analyzed: katame dhammā kusalā  yasmin samaye arūpa upapattiyā maggam bhāveti sabbaso rūpa saññānam samatikkamā paṭigha saññāna  atthaṅgamā nānatta saññānam amanasikārā ākāsa anañcāyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca
translated: What are skillful thoughts?

original: pahānā …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati upekkhāsahagataṁ, tasmiṁ samaye
analyzed: pahānā pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati upekkhā sahagata tasmin samaye
translated: When one cultivates the path for the purpose of rebirth in the formless realm, having completely transcended form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not attending to perceptions of diversity, (perceiving) “space is infinite,” one enters and remains in the dimension of the infinitude of space. With the complete transcending of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, one enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling.

analyzed: phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe
translated: At that time there is contact, … and the rest as above … non-distraction.
These are skillful thoughts.
What are skillful thoughts?

original: Yasmiṁ samaye arūpūpapattiyā maggaṁ bhāveti sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma
analyzed: yasmin samaye arūpa upapattiyā maggam bhāveti sabbaso ākāsa ānañca āyatanam samatikkamma
translated: When one cultivates the path for the purpose of rebirth in the formless realm, having completely transcended the dimension of the infinitude of space,

original: viññāṇañcāyatanasaññāsahagataṁ sukhassa ca pahānā …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja
analyzed: viññāṇañcāyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca pahānā pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja
translated: perceiving, “Consciousness is infinite,” one enters and remains in the dimension of the infinitude of consciousness. With the complete transcending of the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, one enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: viharati upekkhāsahagataṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti …pe…
analyzed: viharati upekkhā sahagata tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe
translated: on that occasion there is contact … down to … there is non-distraction.
These are wholesome thoughts.
What are wholesome thoughts?🔽When one advances from the formless to rebirth in the form worlds,

original: Yasmiṁ samaye arūpūpapattiyā maggaṁ bhāveti sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma🔽ākiñcaññāyatanasaññāsahagataṁ sukhassa ca pahānā …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja
analyzed: yasmin samaye arūpa upapattiyā maggam bhāveti sabbasas viññāṇam ca āyatanam samatikkamma  ākiñcaññāyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca pahānā pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja
translated: having completely transcended the sphere of endless consciousness,🔽thinking ‘space is infinite’, one enters and remains in the sphere of infinite space,

original: viharati upekkhāsahagataṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti …pe…
analyzed: viharati upekkhā sahagata tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe
translated: on that occasion there is contact … down to … there is non-distraction.
These are wholesome thoughts.
What are wholesome thoughts?🔽When one advances from the formless to rebirth in the form worlds,

original: Yasmiṁ samaye arūpūpapattiyā maggaṁ bhāveti sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma🔽nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasaññāsahagataṁ sukhassa ca pahānā …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja
analyzed: yasmin samaye arūpa upapattiyā maggam bhāveti sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma  nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana saññā sahagatam sukhassa ca pahānā pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja
translated: having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space,🔽thinking ‘consciousness is infinite’, one enters and remains in the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: viharati upekkhāsahagataṁ, tasmiṁ samaye phasso hoti …pe… avikkhepo hoti …pe…
analyzed: viharati upekkhā sahagata tasmin samaye phassaḥ hoti pe avikkhepaḥ hoti pe
translated: on that occasion there is contact … down to … there is non-distraction.
These are wholesome thoughts.
The four immaterial jhānas are sixteenfold.
The profitable of the immaterial sphere.
